title: Lebanon says two killed in Israeli strikes
message:
Lebanon's health ministry said Israeli strikes killed two people in the country's south on Wednesday, with Hezbollah announcing the deaths of two of its fighters, the latest cross-border violence amid fears of a full-blown regional war.
The health ministry also said one person was killed and another wounded in an Israeli strike in south Lebanon's Blida village.
The Israeli army said "a number of projectiles" from Lebanon fell in an "open area" without causing injuries.
The violence since October has killed some 570 people in Lebanon, most of them Hezbollah fighters but also including at least 118 civilians, according to an AFP tally.
On the Israeli side, including in the annexed Golan Heights, 22 soldiers and 26 civilians have been killed, according to army figures.

title: Man charged with attempted murder in stabbing of 11 - year - old girl in a London tourism hot spot
message:
A police officer stands at the scene in Leicester Square, as a man was arrested with the accusation of stabbing an 11-year-old girl and 34-year-old woman, in London, Monday Aug. 12, 2024.
(James Manning, PA/AP)LONDON — A man accused of stabbing an 11-year-old girl in London’s bustling theater district was charged Tuesday with attempted murder.
Ioan Pintaru put the girl in a headlock and stabbed her eight times, seriously wounding her, prosecutors said.
The girl was hospitalized and required surgery for wounds to her face, shoulder, wrist and neck area, prosecutor David Burns said.
The attack happened around 11:30 a.m. Monday in Leicester Square, a tourism hot spot, outside a shop selling tea.

title: Russian family who fled Ukraine cross - border attack recalls panic , chaos
message:

title: Germany Locks Down Military Base , Claims Russia Tampered with Water
message:
German politicians have pointed the finger at Russia after two military bases in the country had suspected incursion incidents overnight, with base drinking water apparently targeted.
A German army air base was placed on lockdown for several hours after water testing detected “abnormal values” in the on-base drinking water, and a man-sized hole was discovered in the fence surrounding the facility’s water plant.
A second base, a NATO airbase hosted in Germany was pulled into the incident when there was a foiled attempt to gain entry overnight.
A spokesman said: “As the drinking water system was showing unusual values, the drinking water supply in the barracks was cut off”, a memo was circulated ordering staff at the base not to drink the tap water in any circumstance.
The base was searched and no intruder was found, but a man-sized hole was discovered in the fence surrounding the base’s drinking water plant on Wednesday morning.
event_breakdown:
Suspected Incursion Incidents at Two Military Bases in Germany
==========================================================

Germany's military forces said on Tuesday that intruders had tried to break into two defence facilities, prompting Defence Minister Annegret Kramp-Karrenbauer to order a fresh security review of the nation's military sites.

Water plants for the army installation in Mendig and the NATO air base at Spangdahlem were the focus of the operations, which went on until early morning.

Kramp-Karrenbauer said it was unclear whether the attempts were connected to the Russian attack on Ukraine, which has heightened security concerns in Germany and increased the expectation of possible Russian-linked attacks.

message:

event_breakdown:
The Ukrainian Air Force has released a video offering the best look to date of one of its MiG-29 Fulcrum fighters employing French-made AASM-250 Hammer precision-guided bombs.
The video shows the moment the Fulcrum drops two AASM-250 bombs from its wings, marking the first time the Ukrainian Air Force has released footage of a MiG-29 carrying the air-launched cruise missile. The video also includes low-angle shots of a MiG-29 with a Hammer bomb beneath each wing as it flies past the camera.
It is worth noting that Ukraine received its first batch of 20 AASM-250 bombs in June 2015 under a joint French-German agreement. Both countries have worked with Ukraine to upgrade their air force, with the AASM-250 a key part of their efforts to equip Ukraine with precision-guided munitions. Although the bombs have been in use for several years in Ukraine, this appears to be the first detailed public demonstration of their deployment.
The Ukrainian Air Force comprises the 2nd Brigade of Su-27P and MiG-29 aircraft, the 128th Tactical Aviation Brigade, and the Operational and Tactical Aviation Brigade. The country was spotted testing a Hammer bomb against a remotely piloted aircraft early on in the conflict.
This is a significant development, as it provides Ukraine with a powerful and precise air-to-ground capability.
However, the White House has discussed transferring a similar number of allied MiG-29 Fulcrum fighters to the Ukrainian Air Force.

title: New talks aimed at stopping Israel - Hamas war to take place on Thursday
message:
International mediators are set to hold a new round of talks on Thursday aimed at halting the Israel-Hamas war and securing the release of scores of hostages.
The US, Qatar and Egypt are to meet with an Israeli delegation in Qatar as the Palestinian death toll from the 10-month-old war nears 40,000.
Hamas has not said whether it will participate, accusing Israel of adding new demands to an evolving proposal that had US and international support.
The war began when Hamas-led militants stormed across the heavily-guarded border on October 7 in an attack that shocked Israel’s vaunted security and intelligence services.
Many fear a repeat after the killing of Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh, who was visiting Iran for the inauguration of its new president.

Russian forces that began a full-scale invasion of Ukraine in 2022 had been grinding out steady gains all year.
"We continue to advance further in Kursk," Zelenskiy wrote on Telegram, "from one to two km in various areas since the start of the day".
In the Russian border region of Belgorod, governor Vyacheslav Gladkov declared a state of emergency.
The unprecedented incursion carries major risks for Russia, Ukraine and the West, which is keen to avoid a direct confrontation between Russia and the U.S.-led NATO military alliance that has helped arm Ukraine.
The offensive could leave Ukrainian forces more exposed on other parts of the front, where Russia has been slowly adding to the 18% of Ukrainian territory it now controls.

title: Iowa man allegedly shoots his father in face after complaint about smelly feet
message:
A man shot his father in the face after the victim complained about the son’s smelly feet, according to authorities in Iowa.
He told officers who interviewed him at the hospital that his son had shot him after the pair had argued at home over the younger man’s “stinky feet”.
Carpenter himself then allegedly confirmed to police that he had been in the family’s living room when his father – while in a motorized scooter – said the son’s feet smelled badly.
At that point, Carpenter allegedly said, he walked to his bedroom, grabbed a gun and returned to his father.
Officers arrived at the Carpenter family home after the son called police to report the shooting.

The Palestinian Health Ministry identified the men killed as Wael Misha, 18, and Ahmed Khalil, 20.
The West Bank has seen surging violence since the war in Gaza erupted last year.

title: Israel : Hamas Launched Rockets at Tel Aviv from Humanitarian Area
message:
Hamas launched rockets at Israel on Tuesday from a protected humanitarian area in the Gaza Strip, Israel said on Wednesday, further proof of the degree to which Hamas is violating international law and endangering civilians.
Two rockets were launched from Gaza towards Tel Aviv on Tuesday, the first time Israel’s major coastal city had been targeted since May.
The IDF said in a statement:Earlier today (Tuesday), Hamas terrorists opened fire toward the Humanitarian Route in the area of Rafah.
Consequentially, movement and coordination along the Humanitarian Route has been temporarily halted as the area now constitutes an active combat zone.
In a further statement on Wednesday, the IDF said:Yesterday (Tuesday), the Hamas terrorist organization launched rockets from the Humanitarian Route in Khan Yunis toward central Israel.
event_breakdown:
Event 1: Two rockets launched by Hamas terrorists from Gaza were aimed at Tel Aviv.
Event 2: Rockets launched from the Humanitarian Route in Rafah toward southern Israel.

title: Qatar to host high - stakes Gaza truce talks
message:
Qatar is hosting Gaza ceasefire talks to halt the fighting between Israel and Hamas.
Qatar is set to host Gaza ceasefire talks on Thursday, seeking a so-far elusive agreement that the United States hopes would stop Iran striking Israel and avert a wider war.
Asked whether a ceasefire agreement in Gaza could stave off a feared Iranian attack on Israel, Biden said: "That's my expectation".
In Lebanon, the health ministry reported two killed in separate Israeli strikes, the latest in near-daily cross-border violence throughout the Gaza war.
The Israeli military said its air force had "struck Hezbollah military structures".

message:

message:

Approximately 90 000 fans are expected to fill London’s Wembley Stadium for the first of five shows, with heightened security measures in place, including additional ticket checks.

title: Wounded Palestinians shot dead following drone strike in West Bank : Rights group
message:
Israeli forces have shot at point-blank three Palestinians, including a 17-year-old boy, who had been severely injured in an earlier drone strike in the northern occupied West Bank.
This morning in Tammun in the occupied West Bank, an Israeli drone-fired missile targeted Mohammad Bashar Hasan Bani Odeh, 17.
As he lay injured, Israeli forces ordered a paramedic to leave at gunpoint, then shot Mohammad at point-blank range.
The latest development came a day after five Palestinian were killed by Israeli forces during raids in the West Bank cities of Tubas and Tammun.
Drone attacks in the West Bank have become increasingly common in recent months.

title: Man struck with glass bottle , robbed inside NYC subway station

A man was struck with a glass bottle before being robbed inside a NYC subway station in Queens, the NYPD said.
The attack happened on Saturday around 3 p.m. at the Woodhaven Boulevard subway station in Elmhurst.
According to police, the 42-year-old man was approached by three individuals, who used a glass bottle to strike him before taking his wallet with about $300.
2 men stabbed on subway trainMeanwhile, two men were stabbed on Thursday morning aboard a subway train, the NYPD said.
The stabbing happened just before 7 a.m. on a southbound Q train near the Times Square–42nd Street station.

Only Russia,” Podolyak said as part of his written comments.

title: Ukraine presidential adviser denies Ukraine involvement in Nord Stream explosions
message:
Ukraine presidential adviser denies Ukraine’s involvement in Nord Stream explosionsreuters_tickers2 minutesBy Pavel PolityukKYIV (Reuters) – Ukrainian presidential adviser Mykhailo Podolyak denied his country’s involvement in explosions which damaged the Nord Stream 2 gas pipeline and instead pointed the finger at Russia in comments to Reuters on Thursday.
Only Russia,” Podolyak said as part of his written comments.
The multi-billion dollar Nord Stream 1 and 2 pipelines transporting gas under the Baltic Sea were ruptured by a series of explosions in September 2022, seven months after Russia launched a full-scale invasion of Ukraine.
“Ukraine has nothing to do with the Nord Stream explosions,” Podolyak said, adding that Ukraine did not gain any strategic or tactical advantage from the blasts.
Russia has already blamed the United States, Britain and Ukraine for the blasts, which largely cut Russian gas off from the lucrative European market.
event_breakdown: Ukraine presidential adviser denies Ukraine’s involvement in Nord Stream explosions - In the second week of September 2022, two explosions took place on the Nord Stream 2 pipeline that would bring gas from Russia to Germany under the Baltic Sea. title: Gaza ceasefire talks resume between Israel and Hamas
message:
Talks to end the war in Gaza resumed on Thursday in Qatar as western powers urged both sides to take a deal that could prevent a wider conflict between Iran and Israel.

message:

title: Lebanon says three killed in Israeli strikes
message:
Lebanon's health ministry said Israeli strikes killed two people in the country's south on Wednesday, with Hezbollah announcing the deaths of two of its fighters, the latest cross-border violence amid fears of a full-blown regional war.
The health ministry also said one person was killed and another wounded in an Israeli strike in south Lebanon's Blida village.
The Israeli army said "a number of projectiles" from Lebanon fell in an "open area" without causing injuries.
The violence since October has killed some 570 people in Lebanon, most of them Hezbollah fighters but also including at least 118 civilians, according to an AFP tally.
On the Israeli side, including in the annexed Golan Heights, 22 soldiers and 26 civilians have been killed, according to army figures.

title: As Gaza death toll passes 40 , 000 , corpses are buried in yards , streets , tiered graves
message:
As Gaza death toll passes 40,000, corpses are buried in yards, streets, tiered gravesDEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — Tiers of graves are stacked deep underground in a bloated Gaza cemetery, where Sa’di Baraka spends his days hacking at the earth, making room for more dead.
The dead can sometimes come from kilometers (miles) away, stretches of Gaza where burial grounds are destroyed or unreachable.
The death toll in Gaza since the beginning of the 10-month-old Israel-Hamas war has passed 40,000, according to the Health Ministry in the Hamas-run territory.
Trucked back to Gaza, the bodies are often decomposed and unidentifiable, buried quickly in a mass grave.
Smashed graves and cemeteries off-limitsIsraeli evacuation orders cover much of Gaza, leaving some of the largest cemeteries off-limits.

title: Police say young mother left her 4 kids alone
message:

The CPS officer asked where the other three kids were, and the officers said Battle became confrontational and evasive about the children.

title: Watch : Drones bomb jungle with mosquitoes in fight against dengue fever
message:
One of the drones carrying its payload of mosquitoes - World Mosquito ProgramClick here to view this content.
Raining death from above with unerring precision, drones have quickly emerged as a dominant force on the battlefields of Ukraine.
But thousands of miles away in Fiji, the technology is now being deployed in an altogether different conflict: the fight against dengue fever.
In a world first, drones are being used to release mosquitoes infected with a bacteria that prevents them from spreading the disease.
Previous attempts to release Wolbachia-infected mosquitoes were carried out from the ground, with clouds of adult mosquitoes being released from tubes – often out of car windows.
